contentrichtext.text: '''''Express Weekly''''' was a children's [[comic]] of the late 1950s, and featured, among others: * ''Wulf the Briton'' drawn by [[Ron Embleton]] * ''[[Journey Into Space]]'', from 1956, drawn first by Tacconi, and then Bruce Cornwall and Terence Patrick<ref>Booklet accompanying the 1998 release of ''[[Journey Into Space#The World in Peril|The World in Peril]]'' on audio cassette by BBC Worldwide Ltd</ref> Express Weekly (later TV Express Weekly) was a rival to "[[The Eagle]]" of Dan Dare fame. == References == <!--See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Footnotes for an explanation of how to generate footnotes using the <ref> and </ref> tags and the tag below --> {{reflist}} [[Category:British comics titles]] {{UK-comics-stub}}
